item.title: A First Look at Rigorous Probability Theory (WIP)
item.description:
This post contains solutions to the exercises to Rosenthal’s book. Probably not interesting to anyone but me.

1. The Need For Measure Theory

1.3.2

Suppose $\Omega = {1, 2, 3}$ and $F$ is its powerset. Find necessary and sufficient conditions on the numbers $x = P\{1, 2\},\ y = P\{2, 3\}, \ z = P\{1, 3\}$ which make $P$ a countably additive probability measure.
